intro: Ottoa oenanthoides subvar. major, commonly known as the large-flowered ottoa, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound umbels of small white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branching stems and finely divided, pinnately arranged leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often found in moist, open habitats like woodland edges and wetlands.
